intro: Ixodia, commonly known as the "spiny desert shrub," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Cactaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plants are characterized by their spiny stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, or red. Ixodia species are adapted to survive in harsh desert conditions with minimal water and high temperatures. They play an important role in providing habitat and food for desert wildlife.
